name: LEAP-DT Hand
description: This is a 16 DOF robotic hand inspired by the LEAP hand from Carnegie Mellon. This hand features four DenseTact Minis allowing for a dexterous robotic hand with tactile sensing.

name: Resource Collecting Lunar Rover
description: This was a low-SWaP rover designed as part of Draper's summer intern project. The rover was designed to autonomously collect color-coded resources from craters and return them to the starting point.

name: Interactive Animatronic Caterpillar
description: This caterpillar was my senior capstone project. It has 4 DOF and uses Mediapipe to track a viewer and respond accordingly.

name: Optimal Package Delivery Routing
description: This project investigated the optimal way to route and control a quadrotor that was delivering packages in a discretized grid world avoiding obstacles. Fine control of the quadrotor was done with MCP while the planning was done with Q-learning.

name: Collaborative Robotics Project
description: This project involved two Locobots that had to autonomously arrange a series of colored blocks in a matching pattern without the robots being able to communicate with each other.

name: Predicting NFL Pro-Bowlers
description: Using NFL stats dating back over 50 years, my group tried to predict Pro-Bowl quarterbacks, running backs, and wide receivers using a variety of models.

name: Mimicking Robotic Arm
description: This 2 DOF arm was a mechatronics project that uses a TI MSP432 microcontroller to copy a viewers arm position that is tracked with Mediapipe.

name: Rigatoni
description: This is a self-driving go-kart designed as a part of RoboJackets. This go-kart competed in EVGP Autonomous and won 2nd place in 2021.

name: Faster than the wind
description: This project involved designing and building a wind powered vehicle that could travel faster than the wind.

name: Quadrotor Dynamics Modeling
description: This project involved modeling the dynamics of a quadrotor, simulating them, and designing a control system for the quadrotor
